paragraphs: Hamilton, or Kirikiriroa in Māori, lies on the banks of the Waikato River. The area has long been inhabited by Māori due to its fertile soil and abundant river resources.
European settlement began in the 1860s after the New Zealand Wars, when land was confiscated and used for military settlements. The city was named after Captain John Hamilton.
Today, Hamilton is one of New Zealand’s fastest-growing cities, known for its gardens, innovation, and as a center for agriculture, education, and research.
